If successful, during the target’s next turn, the telepath dictates what actions and maneuvers they perform. GMs should avoid actions that lead to unavoidable character death, however, such as jumping off towering cliffs or shooting oneself in the head, since that’s just not fun.

If they fail, they are immobilized until the start of their next turn. If they fail with :threat:, they are staggered until the start of their next turn instead. If you’re using the fear rules (see page 243), this counts as a fear check, and other effects may apply as well.
